reviewText: A liked of this film only by George C. Scott's work. The history and the other actors are good but Scott makes the difference. He is a strong and imponent actor, and change the manner to see any movie. If you like George  C. Scott, i recommend this movie.

I will like anything with George C. Scott, but this is also a competently made drama.

I really didn't like this movie that well. I didn't care for George C Scott as the bad character and Eric Roberts as the good guy. Only my opinion. My husband didn't like it either and he loves George C Scott.

This is the best made for cable movie that I have ever seen. I first watched it in 1990 when it debuted on HBO. The acting is extremely good, especially by the three leads (Roberts, Lane, and Academy-Award winning legend George C. Scott), but the supporting cast is also excellent. It has a fascinating plot that is undeniably a must-see for those interested in Holocaust aspects of the Second World War. The story is riveting and ends on a jaw-dropping note. Strong sexual content, some mild violence, and harsh language. R-rated for a reason, but a fine quality DVD.
The DVD arrived early and in perfect shape. Play great. This movie makes one really thing. Makes me wonder how many people like this are in US.

Decent story (sort-of) - I'd give it 2 1/2 stars if I could - Not all that well written or directed - and to see George C. Scott so obese was a downer - he should have taken better care of himself.  Good suspense - unrealistic ending.
